docs.title: TurnApps Ecosystem Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation hub for TurnApps. TurnApps is a multi-disciplinary technology project dedicated to bridging the gap between high-level competitive gaming, professional software engineering, and secure web infrastructure. Founded and led by a developer committed to reaching 1 million subscribers by December 2026, TurnApps serves as the foundation for innovation, privacy, and mastery.

docs.title: Our Core Pillars
docs.text:
1. Advanced Software Development (TurnEdit) We believe that powerful tools should respect user privacy. TurnEdit 2.0 is our flagship code editor, rebuilt from the ground up using C# and WPF. It integrates local AI assistance and a modern tabbed interface while maintaining a strictly standalone, secure environment.
  2. Competitive Roblox Mastery TurnApps is not just about code; it is about performance. We analyze and document high-level Roblox mechanics, particularly in the Obby and competitive scenes. Our goal is to demonstrate that technical engineering and elite gaming skills are two sides of the same coin.
  3. Secure Web Infrastructure From our primary domain at turnapps.f5.si to this documentation portal, we maintain a custom-built web ecosystem. We prioritize security (SHA-256 verification, path traversal protection) and transparency in everything we host.

docs.title: Technical Philosophy
docs.text:
• Privacy First: No telemetry. No hidden tracking. Your data belongs to you.
  • Performance Driven: Optimized on Intel Inside architectures to ensure stability and speed for both development and high-frame-rate gaming.
  • Open Progress: We document our journey—from Alpha releases of software to the milestones of our 1M subscriber roadmap—ensuring our community grows with us.

docs.title: 1. Introduction
docs.text:
• These Terms constitute a contract between you and TurnApps and apply to all services and software provided by TurnApps.
  • You must agree to these Terms when you begin using TurnApps and throughout your use of TurnApps.
  • If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use TurnApps.
  • TurnApps may change the Terms of Use without prior notice. Your continued use of the service after such changes constitutes acceptance of the new Terms.

docs.title: 2. Account
docs.text:
• Registering an account for this service is optional.
  • You cannot change your account name. If you wish to change your account name, please create a new account and transfer your data.
  • You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials (including 2FA codes). Any activity performed through your account is deemed to be your own.

docs.title: 3. Prohibited Activities
docs.text:
You are prohibited from engaging in any of the following or similar actions:

  • Violating the GPL (General Public License).
  • Using someone else's account without permission.
  • Disclosing personal information of others.
  • Abusing the TurnApps system or exploiting vulnerabilities.
  • Unauthorized access or login to the server panel, database, or administrative APIs.
  • Excessive requests to the server (DoS/DDoS equivalent).
  • Destructive criticism intended solely to damage the reputation of the software (Constructive feedback is welcome via the Feedback page).
  • Cyber attacks, including but not limited to SQL injection and brute force attacks.
  • Posting advertisements, phishing links, or affiliate links on the forum.
  • Using multiple accounts for the purpose of fraud or ban evasion.
  • Providing download links for computer viruses, malware, or any harmful code.
  • Interfering with the operation of TurnApps or its official domains (turnapps.f5.si).
  • Posting or logging in to the forum with the intent of Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) or Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF).
  • Logging in as an administrator without explicit authorization.
  • Harassment, stalking, or any form of cyberbullying.
  • Posting spam, repetitive content, or low-quality automated posts on the forum.

docs.title: 4. Official Domains and Security
docs.text:
• The only official domain for TurnApps is turnapps.f5.si.
  • TurnApps is not responsible for any damage, data loss, or security breaches caused by downloading software or accessing services from unofficial domains (e.g., turnapps.com).
  • Users are encouraged to report any suspicious websites imitating TurnApps to the official support email.

docs.title: 5. Disclaimer of Warranties
docs.text:
• TurnApps services and software (including TurnEdit) are provided "AS IS" without warranty of any kind, either express or implied.
  • TurnApps does not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free. Temporary outages for maintenance or system errors (503/500 errors) may occur.
  • In no event shall TurnApps be liable for any direct, indirect, or incidental damages arising out of the use or inability to use the service.

docs.title: 6. Maintenance and Data
docs.text:
• TurnApps reserves the right to perform scheduled or emergency maintenance. During such times, a "503 Service Unavailable" status may be returned.
  • While we strive to protect your data using MySQL 9.5 and modern security practices, users are encouraged to keep their own backups of important forum posts or settings.

docs.title: 7. Termination
docs.text: • TurnApps reserves the right to suspend or terminate your account and access to the service at any time, without prior notice, if you violate these Terms.

docs.title: Systems Architecture
docs.text: The TurnApps web ecosystem is designed to be a high-performance, secure, and developer-centric platform. Unlike standard template-based websites, our infrastructure is custom-built to support the integration of software distribution, community forums, and technical documentation.

docs.title: 🏗 Backend Architecture
docs.text: The core of turnapps.f5.si and its subdomains is built with a focus on stability and speed, leveraging Intel-based hardware for efficient processing. Custom Web Stack - Language & Logic: Built using PHP and structured SQL for robust data management and fast response times. - Database Management: Optimized relational databases designed to handle forum threads, user authentication, and project metadata with minimal latency. - Server Environment: Hosted on environment-specific configurations to ensure 24/7 availability for TurnEdit 2.0 installers and documentation. - Hosting: We are using "Shin Cloud for Free" and Github Pages, it is provided by XServer and GitHub.

docs.title: 🛡 Security & Integrity
docs.text: Security is not an afterthought at TurnApps; it is integrated into the system's DNA. 1. Data Integrity We utilize SHA-256 hashing algorithms for verifying software integrity. This ensures that every byte of turnedit-setup.exe downloaded from our systems is identical to the original build. 2. Defensive Programming Our backend implements strict protection against common web vulnerabilities, including: - Path Traversal Protection: Preventing unauthorized access to the server's file system. - Input Validation: Strict sanitization of all user-provided data within the TurnApps forum.

docs.title: 🌐 Subdomain Infrastructure
docs.text: TurnApps utilizes a multi-layered subdomain strategy to keep services organized and scalable: | Subdomain | Purpose | | --- | --- | | turnapps.f5.si | Main portal, News, and Community Forums. | | docs.turnapps.f5.si | Documentation and references (Powered by MkDocs). | | github.com/turnapps | Source code hosting and Release distribution. |

docs.title: 🚀 Automation & Deployment
docs.text: To maintain our goal of reaching 1 Million subscribers by 2026, we automate our technical workflows to focus on content and development: - CI/CD Pipeline: Documentation is automatically built and deployed via GitHub Actions whenever changes are pushed to the main repository. - Static Site Generation: We use MkDocs to convert Markdown into high-speed, SEO-friendly static pages, ensuring that Google can index our technical updates instantly.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: TurnEdit is a lightweight Fluent UI text editor for Windows.Our mission is develop lightweight and scalable software.Built on open source community. TurnEdit highlights performance.

docs.title: Insert date
docs.text: To insert date and time, do below: 1. Click Navigation(Edit > Insert date and time)

docs.title: Opening file
docs.text: To open file do below: - Click Navigation(File > Open) - Input file name - Click "Open". Here's visually explanation: 1. Click Navigation(File > Open) 2. Input file name 3. Click "Open".

docs.title: Saving file
docs.text: To save file do below: 1. Click Navigation(File > Save [or] Save As) 2. Input file name 3. Click "save".

docs.title: Here's visually explanation:
docs.text:
1. Click Navigation(File > Save [or] Save As)
  2. Input file name
  3. Click "Save".

docs.title: Search or Replace
docs.text: To search or replace text, do below: 1. Click Navigation(Edit > Search [or] Replace) 2.1 Input search or replace text 2.2 If Replace, Input replace destination 3. Click "Search" or "Replace".

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
• Click and drag.
  • Press Shift + Left / Right arrow keys.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
• Click and drag.
  • Press Shift + Left / Right / Up / Down arrow keys.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: • Double-click the word.

docs.title: Edit Settings JSON directly
docs.text: The TurnEdit settings is built with JSON. Here's how to edit settings JSON directly:

docs.title: Warning
docs.text:
• Syntax error: If JSON file have syntax error, occurs settings load error and loads default settings. It's highly recommended check JSON syntax manually.
  • Backup settings file: It's highly recommended to backup JSON file.

docs.title: 1. Open a settings JSON file in any text editor
docs.text: JSON file location: C:\Users{username}\AppData\Roaming\TurnEdit\turnedit-settings.json Open a settings file in explorer, or text editor.

docs.title: 2. Reload settings
docs.text:
1. If you opened settings window, close it.
  2. Open settings.
  3. Do nothing and click "OK" button.

docs.title: This guide explains how to manually install plugins for TurnEdit. This process is consistent across all versions of TurnEdit.
docs.text:
[!IMPORTANT] Security Requirement: The sha256.txt file is mandatory for all plugins to ensure integrity and prevent unauthorized modifications.

[!IMPORTANT] Plugins must be .NET assembly.

docs.title: 01.Prepare Plugin Files
docs.text: Plugins are typically distributed as .zip files. Extract the zip file to a temporary location. You should find at least the following two files: - YourPluginName.dll (The actual plugin file) - sha256.txt (Checksum file for security)

docs.title: 02.Locate Installation Directory
docs.text: Open the folder where TurnEdit.exe is installed. You will find two essential folders: TurnEdit/ ├── TurnEdit.exe ├── plugins/ (Place DLLs here) └── checksums/ (Place TXT files here)

docs.title: 03.Deploy Files
docs.text:
Move the extracted files to their respective directories. The checksum file must match the plugin's filename.

Original File Destination and Renaming Example.dll /plugins/Example.dll sha256.txt /checksums/Example-sha256.txt

docs.title: 04.Restart TurnEdit
docs.text: Restart TurnEdit to apply the changes. The software will verify the .dll against the sha256.txt in the checksums folder before loading.

docs.title: Download & Install in Website
docs.text:
1. Click this.
  2. Click the download button.
  3. Open explorer and then click "turnedit-setup.exe"

docs.title: Command prompt(cmd.exe)
docs.text:
Type the command below(you must execute command prompt in administrator):

cd %USERPROFILE%\Downloads
curl -L https://github.com/turnapps/TurnEdit/releases/latest/download/turnedit-setup.exe -o turnedit-setup.exe
start turnedit-setup.exe

docs.title: PowerShell
docs.text:
Type the command below(you must be execute powershell in administrator):

Set-Location "$env:USERPROFILE\Downloads"
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://github.com/turnapps/TurnEdit/releases/latest/download/turnedit-setup.exe" -OutFile "turnedit-setup.exe"
Start-Process "turnedit-setup.exe"

docs.title: Upgrading
docs.text:
1. If not opened TurnEdit, open it.
  2. Navigate menu: Help > Update TurnEdit

docs.title: Operating system
docs.text:
• Minimum version: Windows 10 22H2 or greater
  • .NET version: .NET is contained in the TurnEdit package; if install .NET manually, use .NET 9 or 10.

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text:
• CPU: 1GHz or greater
  • Memory: Minimum 2GB or greater, recommends 4GB or greater
  • Graphics: DirectX 9 or greater
  • Disk free space(e.g. HDD, SSD): 400MB or greater

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: TurnEdit uses rendering engine as DirectX. the rendering engine can't be changed.

docs.title: How to fix settings load errors
docs.text: If occur settings load error when TurnEdit startup, or opening settings screen, try below:

docs.title: Fix the settings file
docs.text: If found JSON error, try below: * Check that it doesn't contain syntax errors. * Check a settings file is JSON properly.

docs.title: File encoding problem
docs.text:
• Check an encoding of settings file is UTF-8.
  • Check a line break code of settings file is CRLF.

docs.title: Check a file is accessible
docs.text: • Check a permission of settings file is granted.

docs.title: Others
docs.text: If this problem continues, please post question to forum.
